queries: A variant of this for some signers has the hands moving down from under the armpits.
verbLexeme: 1. Of a salty, colourless liquid, to come out in drops on the surface of your skin. English = sweat. Formal English = perspire.
2. To be nervous or stressed by a particular situation.
nominalLexeme: 1. The salty, colourless liquid that comes out in drops on the surface of your skin when you are hot or frightened. English = sweat. Formal English = perspiration.
